meanings.definition: A person or thing that creates or follows an outline.
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked the students to be good outliners for their essays.
meanings.sent2: She is known as one of the best outliners in the company for her detailed plans.
meanings.sent3: The outliners at the art class made sure everyone stayed within the lines.
meanings.sent4: His meticulous nature made him an outliner in the world of precision engineering.
meanings.sent5: The outliners of the group project ensured that every detail was carefully planned out.

meanings.definition: A software tool used for organizing and structuring information in a hierarchical manner.
meanings.sent1: The outliners on his computer helped him keep track of all his tasks.
meanings.sent2: She used the outliners to create a clear structure for her presentation.
meanings.sent3: The outliners in the program made data organization a breeze.
meanings.sent4: The outliners functioned like a digital filing cabinet for all his notes.
meanings.sent5: With the help of outliners, he was able to categorize his research findings efficiently.
